page.title: 17PARISHES DOWNDERRY/SEATON
page.content: The block and the main community is divided into two parishes by the ancient boundary of the Seaton river.This boundary has existed since medieval times when it separated the 'hundreds'.The boundary has little relevance in 1985 but it will need a massive groundswell of local opinion to change it.The eastern section is part of the large parish of{St.Germans western area in the small{St.Martins.} Irrational divisions also occur at District and County level. Some representation for change has been made but distant councillors manage to veto local opinion. At parish level the block is represented by 6 members, 3 on each council.One District and one County Councillor represent most of the block, only isolated farms are in other divisions.All belong in the East Cornwall Parliamentary constituency.
